metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18504 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A crash and out-of-bounds read can occur when the buffer of a texture client is freed while it is still in use during graphic operations. This results is a potentially exploitable crash and the possibility of reading from the memory of the freed buffers. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 65.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18504` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
